titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rupert Wildt Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr., and Robert Richards

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:29

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, notes and offprints documenting Rupert Wildt's career as a professor in the Yale University department of astronomy (1946-1976), president of the Association of Universities for Research in Astronomy (1965-1968) and as visiting lecturer at universities in the United States and abroad.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rupert Wildt Papers (MS 800). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in five series and one addition: I. Correspondence, 1946-1974. II. Organizations, 1949-1981. III. Personal Papers, 1898-1968. IV. Writings, 1928-1972. V. Writings of Others, 1876-1974.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, organizational files, notes, writings, and other papers documenting the professional career of astrophysicist Rupert Wildt. The papers were donated to Yale University by Mrs. Rupert Wildt in 1977. They are arranged in five series: I. Correspondence, 1946-1974; II. Organizations, 1949-1981; III. Personal Papers, 1898-1968; IV. Writings, 1928-1972; V. Writings of Others, 1876-1974.
The Rupert Wildt Papers are arranged in sixeen boxes. This includes one box of oversized items arranged at the end of the collection, as well as an addition recieved in 2001.
SERIES I, CORRESPONDENCE, 1946-1974, contains letters with colleagues and associates which detail a variety of academic and professional concerns.

SERIES II, ORGANIZATIONS, 1949-1981, contains files for several academic, scientific, and professional organizations. Files for the Association of Universities for Research in Astronomy (AURA) includes material relating to Wildt's service as president (1965-1968; 1971-1972), chairman of the board (1973-1976), and director (1958-1976). Files for the Kitt Peak National Observatory (KPNO) document Wildt's tenure as director (1965-1971) of that institution.
SERIES III, PERSONAL PAPERS, 1898-1968, includes early family documents and letters of recommendation.

SERIES IV, WRITINGS, 1928-1972, contains drafts of articles; partial bibliographies; notes and equations relating to scientific research (including oversize material in box 15); notes and teaching materials on a range of subjects including cosmochemistry, kinetics, planetochemistry, and thermodynamics; and reprints of articles.

SERIES V, WRITINGS OF OTHERS, 1876-1974, contains typescripts of work collected by Wildt and includes material from students and colleagues. Printed material includes published items of a similar nature.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Rupert Wildt was born in Munich, Germany on June 25, 1905. Wildt arrived in the United States in 1935 and served as a research associate at Princeton (1937-1942), assistant professor at the University of Virginia (1942-1946), and a member of the Yale University faculty (1946-1976). At Yale Wildt held the positions of chairman in the Astronomy Department (1966-1968) and professor emeritus (1973-1976). He was active in several professional organizations. Wildt died in Orleans, Massachusetts on January 9, 1976.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence arranged in two sections: General and Select. General files are arranged in chronological order. Select files are arranged in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains an alphabetical arrangement of files according to the name of the organization.

did.unittitle: Association of Universities for Research in Astronomy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains general files and recommendations; each is arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains writings arranged in five sections: Articles, Bibliographies, Notes and Equations, Notes and Teaching Materials, and Reprints of Articles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains writings arranged in two sections: Typescripts and Printed Material. Each section is arranged in chronological order.
